Package io.github.ai4ci.config.setup

package io.github.ai4ci.config.setup
Configuration types and helpers that describe how a simulation population and its social network are constructed.

The classes in this package provide the immutable configuration objects consumed by the model builders during the setup and baselining stages. The primary responsibilities are to describe:

  • population level inputs such as initial imports and demographic data (see SetupConfiguration);
  • network generation parameters for different graph models (see NetworkConfiguration and its implementations ErdosReyniConfiguration, WattsStrogatzConfiguration and BarabasiAlbertConfiguration);
  • demographic strategies that control how persons are created and how contact strengths are computed (see DemographicConfiguration and its implementations UnstratifiedDemography, AgeStratifiedDemography and LocationAwareDemography).

How these types are used

At experiment bootstrap the ExecutionBuilder and a concrete AbstractModelBuilder consume a SetupConfiguration. The typical flow is:

  1. the builder reads SetupConfiguration and calls NetworkConfiguration.generateGraph(org.jgrapht.graph.SimpleGraph<io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, org.jgrapht.graph.DefaultEdge>) to build the social network graph during the setup stage;
  2. the builder uses an instance of DemographicConfiguration to create person stubs (via DemographicConfiguration.createPersonStub(io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak)) and to compute per‑pair relationship strengths;
  3. during baselining and initialisation the builder and specialised in‑host initialisers consult the execution configuration and the demographic/ad hoc mapping logic to set per‑person and outbreak runtime priors.

Extension and composition guidance

Prefer small, focused changes. The codebase uses a compositional pattern where concrete builders such as DefaultModelBuilder mix small default interfaces that implement single concerns (network setup, outbreak baseliner, person baseliner, in‑host initialisers). To extend the default behaviour consider one of the following approaches:

  • subclass DefaultModelBuilder and override one or two delegation methods (for example DefaultModelBuilder.setupOutbreak(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiableOutbreak, io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler));
  • implement an alternative demographic or network configuration and register it via Jackson polymorphism so it can be selected from JSON;
  • create a custom AbstractModelBuilder or provide a factory that returns a composed builder and wire that factory into ExecutionBuilder.

Quick mapping table

The table below is a compact guide to where common configuration elements are mapped into ABM types. Use the links to navigate the code.

Mapping of configuration elements to ABM fields
Config Builder / method ABM target
SetupConfiguration.getInitialImports() DefaultPersonInitialiser.initialisePerson(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) ImmutablePersonState.getImportationExposure()
SetupConfiguration.getNetwork() DefaultModelBuilder.setupOutbreak(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModifiableOutbreak, io.github.ai4ci.config.setup.SetupConfiguration, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) Populated ModifiableOutbreak social graph
DemographicConfiguration DefaultPersonBaseliner.baselinePerson(io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonBaseline.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler) ImmutablePersonBaseline demographic fields

For more detail follow the links from the builder methods to the small default interfaces in io.github.ai4ci.abm.builders which contain the canonical mapping logic.
